description: quarter +‎ staff, attested since about 1550. Probably originally referred to a staff cut from the heartwood of a certain size of tree which was cleft into four parts, per the OED.

entries.meaning: A wooden staff of an approximate length between 2 and 2.5 meters, sometimes tipped with iron, used as a weapon in rural England during the Early Modern period.
examples: Name my accuſer ſaith he, or I defye thee Kemp at the quart ſtaffe.

entries.meaning: Fighting or exercise with the quarterstaff.
examples: He was very adept at quarterstaff.
